message: I was wondering what device would be better for a student..specifically a MD student.. a iPad or Kindle?..
iPad, of course.  Has so many more possibilities.
@briandvorak based on the choice of Kindle vs. iPad, yes, iPad, but there are so many other options on the horizon.
The Kindle is great for reading but harder for navigating through reference material so you should get the iPad.
yeah, agreeing with others here. a simple rule of thumb, if you think you need anything more than a book reader, iPad is the better option
iPad all the way.
I see... but kindle is more friendly with my eyes.. =) ..but is only to read and in black/white.. =/
The medical apps for iOS are really good IMO.
Get an iPad and download the Kindle app.
@victorau -- yep, that was my thinking as well.
@unwrangle I got you.. but, if I need to read or study a Color Atlas of something.. will be better in kindle or iPad?
@victorau mm..nice point, so the ipad #win .. jeje
but, then what is the use of the kindle then?.. if you can read it in iPad too.. of course the price is the big difference here..
kindle works better as a book reader, either fiction or non fiction. not reference books. if you change the title to 'iPad or kindle for book reader' you'll have more of a debate here
iPad all the way....
@Josesordo I don't even know what Color Atlas is,.. but from the title, you would need to see it in color no?
@unwrangle ah ok..sorry, yeah is in color.. and sometimes need good resolution cuz the complexity.. for example, a atlas of human anatomy .. o_O

As a final year med student, based on that choice go for iPad - you need something which is capable of showing you the nice photos and pictures found in the textbooks. Kindle is more of a novel reading device than a study tool
@gautam oh... good point.. for med student the color in the books is esential =)
@Josesordo I would also recommend the 'differential diagnoses' app by the BMJ - for iPhone if you can get it. It's £5 here in the uk, but I've found it useful :)
so, Apple device's are good for medical use.. =)
That is a sad reality at this moment in time!
@gautam why you say that?.. well, I think there can be some cheap devices, like the android's one.. Apple is too expensive for me =(
Choice is always better for the Market - that's the only reason. Apple make lovely products of course - my laptop and my phone are testament to that. I'm quite bullish on android's future
And yes - their products are very expensive! :(
well, apple have more years in the market than another ones.. so.. ppl trust more on them at the moment.. o_O
eBooks wise, it really depends if you want colour or e-ink. App-wise, the iPad has some very nice looking medical apps - I can't say I've really used them though, not really in the medical space.
